intro: Trianosperma rigidum, commonly known as the rigid flatworm plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Triurospermataceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species in the botanical world.
